title: uneng
author: uneng
content: The dagestani celebrity known by millions of people for his toddler appearance and fights' videos is one of the adepts of NFTs. He has launched his own collection of 10,000 unique NFT cards portraying himself cartoonized in different remarkable characters of the media and history. His NFTs can be be found on Open Sea marketplace.QuoteWhat Utility Does a Crypto Hasbulla NFT Have?One of the major selling points of Crypto Hasbulla is its utility. Some of these include a chance to meet Hasbulla Magomedov virtually or in real life, Hasbi token airdrops after the 10K collection is sold out, access to semi-annual, real-life events, and a chance to earn a passive income by staking the NFTs. Holders will also get access to exclusive merch raffles, premiere combat sports events, and Hasbulla’s upcoming metaverse game. Crypto Hasbulla has also partnered with Barstool Sports and Eagle FC to offer holders a range of perks.QuoteHow Much is a Hasbulla NFT?As previously mentioned, the Crypto Hasbulla NFTs are released in stages, with varying, pre-determined prices. Currently, the NFTs have a floor of 0.2 ETH or about $307 (at the time of writing). However, the rarer NFTs in the collection will cost you a higher amount.The Story Behind Hasbulla Magomedov’s NFTsDo you know Hasbulla Magomedov? What do you think about his NFT collection, does it have a future and is it ethical to use his image for that purpose?

comments.author: ryzaadit
comments.body: Shit, and shit never ask again ~XD.Do you think he know anything about "Crypto" at least? Let's be honest most of some non-user crypto who are suddenly created like 'NFTs" they just want money or do some contract with the creator/company of his NFTs.He don't even know or have information at least about Crypto. I even avoided any Artist NFTs.

comments.author: o48o
comments.body: Quote from: uneng on January 18, 2023, 11:40:37 PMDo you know Hasbulla Magomedov? What do you think about his NFT collection, does it have a future and is it ethical to use his image for that purpose?Can't say i do know anything about Hasbulla. But people on generaö seem to be hoping that these kind of nft collections would just die out eventually. But of course they don't. These are stupid and that's why they get the spotlight and money. And as nft investors have a black belt in stupid. It's a win-win combo.And at least these seem to have some work behind them and they are not just Midjourney images. (I am currently learning to love NFTs and shitcoins. Because If i can't beat them i must join them.)

comments.author: NFTmetria
comments.body: Surprisingly, this collection even has sales activity, albeit a very small one. Due to the low threshold for entry into the NFT industry, there are many scammers in the NFT. Everyone can register on OpenSea and create their own collection, not the fact that this collection is definitely related to the influencer.

comments.author: justdimin
comments.body: Quote from: ryzaadit on January 19, 2023, 10:26:58 PMShit, and shit never ask again ~XD.Do you think he know anything about "Crypto" at least? Let's be honest most of some non-user crypto who are suddenly created like 'NFTs" they just want money or do some contract with the creator/company of his NFTs.He don't even know or have information at least about Crypto. I even avoided any Artist NFTs.He only look like a kid but he is 20 yrs old now and with that age I think he already heard and knows something about crypto but it's also possible that he is only being hired as a promoter and people behind him only uses his fame to market the NFTs easily. It's true, so many people immediately jump in because of the earning potential but this ain't new.It's already happening before starting the pump of BT, ICOs and the meme coins but the latest of them all would be these NFT's. They think it's an easy money. It's true if you have a connection or you are a popular figure. If we are a fan then I think it's not wrong to support the product of our idols. If not then just ignore them.

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: Quote from: NFTmetria on January 21, 2023, 08:19:23 AMSurprisingly, this collection even has sales activity, albeit a very small one. Due to the low threshold for entry into the NFT industry, there are many scammers in the NFT. Everyone can register on OpenSea and create their own collection, not the fact that this collection is definitely related to the influencer.In this case it's real. He is promoting it on his official Twitter and OpenSea page also has a blue seal indicating it's a verified seller. But indeed, every caution is needed in a sea of scammers this crypto ocean is.https://twitter.com/HasbullaHive/status/1615521571942064132Quote from: justdimin on January 21, 2023, 09:56:22 AMHe only look like a kid but he is 20 yrs old now and with that age I think he already heard and knows something about crypto but it's also possible that he is only being hired as a promoter and people behind him only uses his fame to market the NFTs easily. It's true, so many people immediately jump in because of the earning potential but this ain't new.It's already happening before starting the pump of BT, ICOs and the meme coins but the latest of them all would be these NFT's. They think it's an easy money. It's true if you have a connection or you are a popular figure. If we are a fan then I think it's not wrong to support the product of our idols. If not then just ignore them.I don't know if his physical condition also affects his mental development, if not he has full conditions of learning and understanding about NFTs and crypto in general. Anyway, there is someone behind him managing these things, he is just the celebrity, the poster boy who will have to advertise the product and meet big investors, as it's part of the benefits' program. So, it's really for fans who want to meet Hasbulla for real and hang out with him.

comments.author: nimogsm
comments.body: It's just that this Internet character decided to make even more money with this tool.He is quite famous and has already learned how to make money with the help of his celebrity and recognition.I agree with the comment here: he has nothing to do with cryptocurrency and this is just another attempt to make money from his fans and that's it.

comments.author: Pierre 2
comments.body: He 's very well known celebrity even in my country Türkiye. I keep seeing him on instagram stories and youtube shorts. I always felt like people around him trying to milk his fanbase. It started with likes and views, continued with boxing match revenue and now turn of nft came. Its strange. But I liked them giving opportunity at least meet him in person. I would like to have picture together with him - it would be nice for reactions and likes on social media. As nft collection I don't think it will be significant anyways.

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: Quote from: Pierre 2 on January 25, 2023, 09:53:23 AMHe 's very well known celebrity even in my country Türkiye. I keep seeing him on instagram stories and youtube shorts. I always felt like people around him trying to milk his fanbase. It started with likes and views, continued with boxing match revenue and now turn of nft came. Its strange. But I liked them giving opportunity at least meet him in person. I would like to have picture together with him - it would be nice for reactions and likes on social media. As nft collection I don't think it will be significant anyways.Talking about Turkey, maybe the next NFT collection to be launched is going to be from Koksal Baba, what do you think? They have similar fan-bases, and I believe he is even more popular than Hasbulla in Turkey, since he is native from your country, and he also has a history of participating advertisements' campaigns, video clips plus million of views on Youtube.

comments.author: Strongkored
comments.body: I only know his name after reading this thread so don't know if his NFT will have a future and will give something good to holders. I've always been a person who has never been interested in nor touched whoever's NFT issued because I never considered it a wise investment and had a good future this is just like a waste of our money

I've always been a person who has never been interested in nor touched whoever's NFT issued because I never considered it a wise investment and had a good future this is just like a waste of our moneyI also think that NFT is not very promising and the hype seems to be over,so I don't see the future of NFT going to be bright although we never know what will happen next,whether it's true or not seeing that nowadays many people are no longer interested in NFT.

comments.author: fmz89
comments.body: Lol this guy to funny for nft, but we know people arround him, is crypto mania, so dunno this gonna milked by who.Middle east known fast growing crypto adoption but lot of scammer around there, especially dubai getting hot crypto hub these day, many projects move there. Because crypto friendly environment and the people are welcoming

comments.author: yohananaomi
comments.body: Quote from: Strongkored on January 26, 2023, 03:59:10 AMI only know his name after reading this thread so don't know if his NFT will have a future and will give something good to holders. I've always been a person who has never been interested in nor touched whoever's NFT issued because I never considered it a wise investment and had a good future this is just like a waste of our moneyI also just found out and I tried to search on Google and indeed he is a person who has special advantages and that can make him famous on TikTok and Instagram. Right now someone is trying their luck at NFT and it's legit, but I agree with you that I don't see it going to be a good future.Quote from: ningrum on January 27, 2023, 02:14:10 PMI also think that NFT is not very promising and the hype seems to be over,so I don't see the future of NFT going to be bright although we never know what will happen next,whether it's true or not seeing that nowadays many people are no longer interested in NFT.NFT is always accompanied by hype and it is clear that there will be a time, I don't believe it will continue to be something that will be promising in the future. but indeed we have to admit that there are still many who have funds and like something different from the others and feel that anything can be done with the funds they have. as long as they still exist and they want to do it, it will continue to exist and who knows how long.
